content.title: Kommerell Diverticulum
content.description: Aortic diverticulum at origin of aberrant subclavian artery

key_concepts.details: Remnant of embryonic aortic arch; outpouching at origin of aberrant subclavian artery
Seen with aberrant right subclavian artery (ARSA) or aberrant left subclavian with right arch
May cause dysphagia lusoria; can dilate and rupture
Consider repair if >3 cm diameter or symptomatic; open or hybrid approaches

content.clinical_significance: Aneurysmal degeneration risk increases with diverticulum size
content.statement: Kommerell Diverticulum is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Pathology Congenital that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.

explanation.intuition: Understanding Kommerell Diverticulum helps build foundational knowledge. The concept connects to broader principles in the field.
explanation.key_insight: The key aspects of Kommerell Diverticulum include core principles, common applications, and integration with related concepts.
explanation.technical_details: Technical details involve specific mechanisms, measurements, and evidence-based applications of Kommerell Diverticulum.

citations.source: Harrison's Principles of Internal Medicine, 21st ed. McGraw-Hill.
